classFeatures.name: Spellcasting
entries: Whether bestowed by a higher power or simply a rare natural ability, those known as Carillon direct both arcane and divine energies through precise motions and specific types of sound.

Often discovered by clerics and others of religious orders, a Carillon can touch the Weave to show the essence of an entity - then use their years of study and training with specialised tools to control or condemn the entity as the situation requires.

A Carillon may only use sound to cast. They have the most control when using their bells, but in an emergency can attempt to produce the same notes by singing, whistling, or striking an object that will cause the correct note to sound.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: At 1st level, you know three cantrips of your choice from the Carillon spell list. You learn an additional Carillon cantrip of your choice at 4th level and another at 10th level.

entries.name: Preparing and Casting Spells
entries: The Carillon table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your Carillon spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

You prepare the list of Carillon spells that are available for you to cast, choosing from the Carillon spell list. When you do so, choose a number of Carillon spells equal to your Wisdom modifier + your Carillon level (minimum of one spell). The spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

For example, if you are a 3rd-level Carillon, you have four 1st-level and two 2nd-level spell slots. With a Wisdom of 16, your list of prepared spells can include six spells of 1st or 2nd level, in any combination. If you prepare the 1st-level spell cure wounds, you can cast it using a 1st-level or 2nd-level slot. Casting the spell doesn't remove it from your list of prepared spells.

You can change your list of prepared spells when you finish a long rest. Preparing a new list of Carillon spells requires time spent practising ward forms: at least 1 minute per spell level for each spell on your list.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your Carillon spells, as you draw on your knowledge of various deathforms to focus your casting. You use your Wisdom whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Wisdom modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a Carillon spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Carillon Bells
entries: The main tools of a Carillon are curious - bells without clappers, made of metal or crystal or strong glass, that emit a particular note depending on its size. Only a Carillon can cause the bells to sound, their unique affinity forming the striking force that brings out the tone. Bells may be used alone or in pairs; some acting in favour of the Carillon and their allies, while others ring in pain and compulsion to their enemies.

Your bells are how you channel your spells, and how you cast them out towards enemies. If you are without your bells or any other item that can be rung or struck to cause sound, your spells are harder to cast as you rely on whistling or singing to carry the required notes. Your spell DC is reduced by 2 when attempting a spell with an improvised or vocal casting focus.

A full set comprises of 5 bells, each a different size, but still small enough for even a halfling to handle with a single hand. Each is marked in some way with it's 'note-name'; depending on the bells' material, this mark can be carved, painted, or even acid-etched into either the body or the handle.

rows: Even the tiniest sound from this bell can broaden the ringer's senses to let them help or hinder - detection spells, invisibility spells, and spells that empower use this bell
Allows the ringer control over nature and the elemental forces of fire, earth, air, water - thunder- and lightning-based spells are also cast using this bell
The bell of life and death - healing, reviving, and restoring spells use this bell, as well as ones that banish
Empowers the ringer with the ability to affect a person on a mental or spiritual level - spells that deal with psychic or radiant effects, as well as charming spells
The tone from the heaviest bell hits with great physical force - the sound can bludgeon, pierce, or slash whatever it is directed at

entries: At 2nd level, you are aware of aspects of certain creatures that may be of use in difficult situations.

Choose two types of enemies: Aberration, Elemental, Fey, Fiend (simple or shapechanger fiends only - not devil/demon/yugoloth), Monstrosity, Undead. You have advantage on Intelligence checks to recall information about them.
Knowledge brings gifts, and for a Carillon those often come in the form of new ways to channel intent through sound.

You add one of the following spells to your prepared spells list: {@spell Faerie Fire|phb} (Deria), {@spell Absorb Elements|xge} (Fysi), {@spell Healing Word|phb} (Rauha), {@spell Command|phb} (Tounao), {@spell Ice Knife|xge} (Gildi)

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeatures.name: Sonorous Aura
entries: At 5th level, your skill with your bells allows them to both boost and distract at the same time.

When a creature within 60 feet of you makes an attack roll, ability check, or damage roll, you can use your reaction to ring whichever bell you have drawn as a spell-less distraction. The creature takes a {@dice 1d6} penalty to its roll, while all of your allies within 30 feet gain advantage on attacks made against that creature until the start of your next turn. You can choose to use this feature after the creature makes its roll, but before the DM determines whether the attack roll or ability check succeeds or fails, or before the creature deals damage. The creature is immune if it cannot hear you.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

classFeatures.name: Quartet
entries: Familiar sounds bring with them new wisdom.

You add one of the following spells to your prepared spells list: {@spell Aid|phb} (Deria), {@spell Flame Blade|phb} (Fysi), {@spell Lesser Restoration|phb} (Rauha), {@spell Mind Spike|xge} (Tounao), {@spell Spiritual Weapon|phb} (Gildi)
